ygData.subject: RE: Meditation change?
ygData.msgSnippet: Exactly. It s the strategic placing of skills that makes us yearn for the next level. If it weren t for this, the game would seem too easy. I think this kind
ygData.messageBody:
Exactly. It's the strategic placing of skills that makes us yearn for the
next level. If it weren't for this, the game would seem too easy. I think
this kind of game balance is great for the most part. However, I question
certain classes, which is why I choose to play the ones that I think have
the best balance.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Perhaps a Princess... [SMTP:sarah@...]
> Sent: Friday, July 23, 1999 11:36 AM
> To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Meditation change?
>
> From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>
>
> Pure spellcasters get meditate sooner than Priest classes.
> Just like pure spellcasters get their spells sooners than priest classes.
>
> This is a tradeoff you make since you get more melee skills than spell
> casters
> I see clerics that can actually afford to be hit a few times at higher
> levels. Whereas, with pure spellcasters, even at 35+ in level, they
> are being nearly killed (and killed) by MOBs MUCH lower in level
> than them. if you get a MOB on THEM during a dungeon crawl, you
> HAVE to get the MOB off right away.
>
> Be patient. Level 8 will come. My druid is having some of the same
> impatience
> problems being level 13 with level 14 dangling in front of her eyes :)
>
> EVERY level of spells, by the time it becomes close to time to your
> next level, starts to look weak against the monsters. Similarly with
> meditate. I don't think anything needs to change. This just shows that
> they chose a good place to put the skill in, whenyou absolutely
> can not stand to wait any longer :)
>
> Sarah Heacock
>

> > From: "Walt Zimbeck" <wzimbeck@...>
